items.q: I had to quit my job because I couldn't keep up with the fast ____________________.
There is a small alarm clock on the ____________________ next to the bed.
If you ____________________ the steps carefully, you should be able to bake a perfect pie.
We were driving during the ____________________ and couldn't see two feet in front of the car.
My grandmother's ____________________ potatoes are so delicious because she adds a lot of butter.
During soccer practice, the players ____________________ around the field to impress their coach.
The top shelf of the bookcase is very dirty because I haven't ____________________ it in months.
This semester has been very ____________________ for the students. With all the special assignments and homework, they do not have any time for anything else.
Several major hurricanes caused ____________________ damage in the area. Even after one year, many homes and businesses still haven't been repaired or rebuilt.
Potential students must follow many ____________________ when applying to a university. They must provide test scores, transcripts, applications, and more.
Many students use electronic readers because ____ are easier to carry than books. a. it b. they c. their
Ms. Turner works at the high school. ____ is a science teacher. a. He b. Her c. She
One of the children broke ____ leg. a. hers b. his c. their
Did the student forget ____ homework? a. he's b. her c. their
Neither Camilla nor Victoria is giving ____ opinion on the matter. a. her b. their c. his
The kitten climbed out of ____ bed several times. a. hers b. it c. its
No one remembered to bring ____ identification to the test. a. their b. his or her c. they
Lou Gehrig's disease is a terrible illness. ____ robs patients of the ability to use their muscles. a. It b. Its c. It's
Maya asked the coach to give the team members ____ awards. a. her b. their c. its
When tourists travel by plane, ____ should put medications in a carry-on bag. a. they b. you c. he or she
Choose the most specific description. a. He's nice. b. He's a good guy. c. He listens to everything I say.
Choose the most specific description. a. The field was muddy. b. The mud in the field came above my ankles. c. The field was wet and muddy.
Choose the most specific description. a. My hair was dry. b. My hair felt dry. c. My hair was so dry that it felt like straw.
Choose the most specific description. a. The lightning lit up my bedroom. b. There was a lot of lightning. c. I saw lightning and heard thunder.
Choose the most specific description. a. There were a lot of people at the concert. b. There were over 3,000 people at the concert. c. Many people attended the concert.
Choose the adjective that does not give a clear and precise description. a. evil b. mean c. malicious
Choose the adjective that does not give a clear and precise description. a. immaculate b. spotless c. clean
Choose the adjective that does not give a clear and precise description. a. look b. stare c. glare
Choose the adjective that does not give a clear and precise description. a. clever b. smart c. wise
Choose the adjective that does not give a clear and precise description. a. loud b. deafening c. thunderous

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. If you If you want to be safe, a person has to remember to lock all the car doors when driving. b. If you want to be safe, they have to remember to lock all the car doors when driving. c. If you want to be safe, you have to remember to lock all the car doors when driving.

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. You should turn down the thermostat if you want to reduce energy costs. b. One should turn down the thermostat if you want to reduce energy costs. c. You should turn down the thermostat if one wants to reduce energy costs.

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. Andrea put several types of deer repellent in her garden, but some of it got in anyway. b. Andrea put several types of deer repellent in her garden, but some of them got in anyway. c. Andrea put several types of deer repellent in her garden, but some of the deer got in anyway.

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. When you buy a new car, you should do research before going to a car dealer. b. When you buy a new car, a person should do research before going to a car dealer. c. When you buy a new car, they should do research before going to a car dealer.

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. You need to practice when children first start riding bikes. b. Children need to practice when they first start riding bikes. c. Children need to practice when you first start riding bikes.

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. Oliver really likes soccer and basketball. He likes it because the action is fast-paced. b. Oliver really likes soccer and basketball. He likes them because the action is fast-paced. c. Oliver really likes soccer and basketball. He likes you because the action is fast-paced.

Which sentence contains the correct pronoun reference? a. Please take the silverware out of the drawer and then clean the drawer. b. Please take the silverware out of the drawer and then clean it. c. Please take the silverware out of the drawer and then clean them.
to _____ a floor
a combination _____ several things
constant _____ of traffic
the discussion centered _____ politics
a movie _____
alternative _____ of energy
a _____ of books
to adapt _____ something new
the paper will _____ fire
to _____ a purpose

Which sentence should be the ninth sentence of this paragraph? Write the letter of the sentence. __________
Which sentence should be the tenth sentence of this paragraph? Write the letter of the sentence. __________

Write about your best vacation. Add adjectives or prepositional phrases to make your sentences more specific and descriptive.
